repository.corpname: Special Collections Research Center, The George Washington University

did.unittitle: Armand Weiss Washington Academy of Sciences and George Washington University related materials collection
did.abstract: Armand Weiss is a alumnus of the George Washington University who served as president of the Washington Academy of Sciences from 1990-1991. This collection contains administrative files from the Washington Academy of Sciences from 1983 to 1992, as well as materials from the George Washington University School of Government and Business Administration Doctoral Association, the George Washington University School of Government and Business Administration Alumni Association, and the George Washington University General Alumni Association.
did.physloc: Materials are stored off-site, and will require additional retrieval time. Please contact the Special Collections Research Center for more information.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains administrative files from the Washington Academy of Sciences from 1983 to 1992, as well as materials from the George Washington University School of Government and Business Administration Doctoral Association, the George Washington University School of Government and Business Administration Alumni Association, and the George Washington University General Alumni Association.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Armand Weiss is a alumnus of the George Washington University who served as president of the Washington Academy of Sciences from 1990-1991. He received a BS and MBA from the Wharton School at the University of Pennsylvania, and a Doctor of Business Administration from the George Washington University in 1971. He began his career in the Navy, as Assistant to the Auditor General, then served as project director at the Center for Naval Analyses and the Logistics Management Institute. He then began a career in the federal government, first as the Director of Systems Integration and Coordinator of Project Independence at the Federal Energy Administration in 1973, and as the first Coordinator of the U.S. Strategic Petroleum Reserve. He then worked as Senior Economist of the National Commission on Supplies and Shortages in 1976. After his federal career, Weiss founded Associations International, Inc., a nonprofit management company. In addition to his work with the Washington Academy of Sciences, he has been very active in alumni associations, Democratic political activities, philanthropic organizations, and operations research organizations.

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aids
otherfindaid.p: Please see RG0026 Office of Alumni Relations Records, Series 5: http://library.gwu.edu/ead/rg0026.xml#ref347 and Series 15: http://library.gwu.edu/ead/rg0026.xml#ref1354 for more information on the George Washington University General Alumni Association.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Collection: Organized into two series: Washington Academy of Sciences, and George Washington University alumni materials

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Please cite unpublished materials in the following way:
Please provide the title and date of item, catalog number (if applicable it will be found written on the folder), name of the collection, name of the repository, and location of the repository.

Example: James Oglethorpe to the Trustees, 13 January 1876, RG0001 Series 1, Box 4, Folder 3. Records of the Board of Trustees, Special Collections Research Center, Gelman Library, The George Washington University, Washington, D.C.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Some material may be copyrighted or restricted. It is the patron's obligation to determine and satisfy copyright or other case restrictions when publishing or otherwise distributing materials found in the collections.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains administrative files from the Washington Academy of Sciences from 1983 to 1992, including financial information, membership, correspondence, bylaws, and minutes.

did.unittitle: Washington Academy of Sciences reactions and meetings
Washington Academy of Sciences Vice President -- Admin

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains administrative files kept by Armand Weiss including the constitutions, bylaws, minutes, and correspondence of the following alumni organizations from 1968 through 1989: the George Washington University School of Government and Business Administration Doctoral Association, the George Washington University School of Government and Business Administration Alumni Association, and the George Washington University School General Alumni Association.
